EV isolated method: To prepare EV-depleted FBS for use in MSC-EV isolation and in vitro efficacy experiments, FBS was ultracentrifuged at 120,000 × g for 18 h (Optima L-90 K ultracentrifuge, SW32.1 rotor, k-factor 229; Beckman Coulter, Indianapolis, IN, USA) (Shelke et al., 2014). The MSCs were seeded at 5000 cells per cm2 in a 150 mm dish (#20151, SPL Life Sciences Co. Ltd.). When they reached 80–90% confluency, the culture medium was replaced with α-MEM containing 10% EV-depleted FBS. After 48 h, the culture medium was collected and centrifuged at 300g for 3 min to remove cell debris. After centrifugation at 2000g for 10 min, the supernatant was transferred to a new tube, centrifuged again at 10,000g for 30 min, and ultracentrifuged at 178,000g for 2 h. OptiPrep™ (iodixanol) density gradient ultracentrifugation was performed to obtain highly purified EVs
